cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles east of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly west-northwest, forecast to turn north then northeast, tracking toward the north-central Gulf Coast with the center expected to cross the Mississippi/Alabama coast

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City, Louisiana, to Navarre, Florida, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (metropolitan New Orleans)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) with occasional hurricane-force gusts possible Tuesday into early Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge of 3–5 ft possible along the Mississippi River levee system and connecting bays near the port as water is funneled into Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches of rain with locally higher totals; life-threatening flash flooding possible around the lower Mississippi River valley.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible in outer bands; dangerous waves and rip currents hampering navigation on the lower river and adjacent sounds.
